alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Effingham (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 22 at 3:50PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR JASPER...CUMBERLAND...NORTHEASTERN CLAY AND EASTERN EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 350 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Neoga to near Wheeler to near Ingraham, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Toledo and Jewett around 355 PM CST. Newton, Greenup and Hidalgo around 400 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ste. Marie, Hazel Dell and Willow Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 173 and 179. Interstate 70 between mile markers 101 and 126. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central, southeastern and east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln.
